headline.print_headline: Suárez Is Suspended For Using Racial Slur

docs.snippet: The English F.A. on Tuesday fined and suspended the Liverpool striker Luis Suárez, finding that his verbal abuse of an opponent was racist.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suárez, Liverpool's top scorer this season in the English Premier League, was suspended eight games and fined $62,000 Tuesday by the English Football Association. The F.A. found Suárez guilty of racially abusing Manchester United's Patrice Evra on Oct. 15 in a game that ended in a 1-1 tie at Liverpool's Anfield stadium.
docs.abstract: The English F.A. on Tuesday fined and suspended the Liverpool striker Luis Suárez, finding that his verbal abuse of an opponent was racist.

docs.snippet: Despite emerging as Latin America’s rising power, Brazil still trails its neighbors in prosecuting officials for crimes that include murder, disappearance and torture.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite emerging as Latin America’s rising power, Brazil still trails its neighbors in prosecuting officials for crimes that include murder, disappearance and torture.
docs.abstract: Memo From Brasilia; commission created by Brazilian authorities to examine the abuses of Brazil's long dictatorship has come under fierce criticism from both the country's military establishment and from some of the torture victims and relatives of people killed during the dictatorship; the tension reveals how Brazil still trails its neighbors in prosecuting officials for crimes that include murder, kidnapping and torture.

headline.seo: Search for Truth as Ghosts Stir From Brazil’s Military Rule
headline.main: An Uneasy Search for Truth as Ghosts From Military Rule Start to Stir
headline.print_headline: An Uneasy Search for Truth as Ghosts From Military Rule Start to Stir

byline.contributor: Lis Moriconi and Erika O’Conor contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro.

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez, Liverpool's top scorer this season in the English Premier League, was suspended eight games and fined $62,000 Tuesday by the English Football Association. The F.A. found Suarez guilty of racially abusing Manchester United's Patrice Evra...
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez, Liverpool's top scorer this season in the English Premier League, was suspended eight games and fined $62,000 Tuesday by the English Football Association. The F.A. found Suarez guilty of racially abusing Manchester United's Patrice Evra on Oct. 15 in a game that ended in a 1-1 tie at Liverpool's Anfield stadium. In a statement on its Web site, the F.A. said it had found ''a charge of misconduct against Luis Suarez proven.'' The statement said Suarez, 24, a Uruguay international, had ''used insulting words towards Mr. Evra during the match'' that included a reference to Evra's color.
docs.abstract: Liverpool soccer club's top scorer Luis Suarez is suspended eight games and fined $62,000 by the English Football Assn for racially abusing Manchester United's Patrice Evra, who is black; Suarez has consistently denied the charge and has appealed the suspension; other soccer news noted. (M)
